cat > app/__init__.py <<'PY'\nfrom __future__ import annotations

import os
from typing import Optional

from flask import Flask
from flask_login import LoginManager
from dotenv import load_dotenv

from sqlalchemy import create_engine
from sqlalchemy.orm import scoped_session, sessionmaker

# ---- Globals kept minimal; app holds references post-init
login_manager = LoginManager()


def create_app() -> Flask:
    """Application factory."""
    load_dotenv()  # loads .env if present

    app = Flask(__name__)

    # --- Core config
    app.config["SECRET_KEY"] = os.getenv("SECRET_KEY", "dev-change-me")
    # DATABASE_URL examples:
    #   sqlite:///app.db
    #   postgresql+psycopg://user:pass@localhost:5432/mydb
    app.config["DATABASE_URL"] = os.getenv("DATABASE_URL", "sqlite:///app.db")

    # --- Database (plain SQLAlchemy; no Flask-SQLAlchemy)
    engine = create_engine(
        app.config["DATABASE_URL"],
        future=True,
        pool_pre_ping=True,      # avoid stale connections
    )
    SessionLocal = scoped_session(
        sessionmaker(bind=engine, autoflush=False, autocommit=False, future=True)
    )

    # expose for use elsewhere: current_app.session, current_app.engine
    app.engine = engine            # type: ignore[attr-defined]
    app.session = SessionLocal     # type: ignore[attr-defined]

    @app.teardown_appcontext
    def cleanup_db(exception: Optional[BaseException]) -> None:
        # remove session at end of request/app context
        SessionLocal.remove()

    # --- Auth
    login_manager.init_app(app)
    login_manager.login_view = "auth.login"  # we'll create auth blueprint soon

    @login_manager.user_loader
    def load_user(user_id: str):
        """Defer import until models exist to avoid circulars."""
        try:
            from .models import User  # type: ignore
        except Exception:
            return None
        # NOTE: User must implement flask_login.UserMixin
        try:
            return app.session.get(User, int(user_id))  # type: ignore[attr-defined]
        except Exception:
            return None

    # --- Blueprints (main present now; auth will be added later)
    from .routes import bp as main_bp
    app.register_blueprint(main_bp)

    # --- Health endpoint
    @app.get("/health")
    def health():
        return {"status": "ok"}, 200

    return app
PY

cat > run.sh <<'SH'\n#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -euo pipefail
export FLASK_APP=app:create_app
export FLASK_ENV=development
if [ ! -d ".venv" ]; then
  python3 -m venv .venv
fi
source .venv/bin/activate
python -m pip install -U pip
pip install -r requirements.txt
if [ ! -f ".env" ]; then
  printf "SECRET_KEY=dev-change-me\nFLASK_DEBUG=1\n" > .env
fi
flask run --port 5000
SH && chmod +x run.sh
